problem.markdown: >>I want to write a more sophisticated polling tool than edX's built-in Poll, and I'd like to do it as a JSInput problem. Can I do this? << (!) No, you can't do it at all. (x) Yes, but you need an outside server to store learner responses. ( ) Yes, you can do it with a JSInput problem. [explanation] JSInput problems can only obtain the state for the current user, so you can't show your learner what other users entered. If you have a secure server, you could store things there, but you might be better off just iframing in an existing survey platform like SurveyMonkey, Google Forms, or Qualtrics. [explanation]
